threat: If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted page and had scripting enabled, a remote attacker could exploit this to bypass security protections to obtain sensitive information or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird.
An attacker could potentially exploit this to execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird if scripting were enabled.
A remote attacker could exploit this to conduct URL spoofing and phishing attacks if scripting were enabled.

If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could possibly exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird.
If a user had scripting enabled and was tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could possibly exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash.
special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
After a standard system update you need to restart Thunderbird to make all
the necessary changes.
